de.nec.nle.siafu.model

Class BinaryOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Overlay
      • de.nec.nle.siafu.model.BinaryOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Overlayable

    public class BinaryOverlay
extends Overlay
    A binary overlay returns a BooleanType object (a publishable boolean) set to true or false depending on whether the value at a given postion is above or below a unique threshold.
    Author:
    Miquel Martin

      • BinaryOverlay

        public BinaryOverlay(String name,
             InputStream is,
             org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration simulationConfig)
        Create a binary overlay from an image.
        Parameters:
        name - the overlay name
        is - the InputStream with the image that represents the values
        simulationConfig - the configuration with the threshold details

      • BinaryOverlay

        public BinaryOverlay(String name,
             int[][] value,
             int threshold)
        Create an overalay from scratch by providing all the necessary parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - the overlay name
        value - the value matrix of the overlay
        threshold - the threshold beyond which the overlay value becomes true

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public BooleanType getValue(Position pos)
        Return the value of the overlay as a BooleanType object. The value of the return will be true if the matrix value at the given position is above the threshold, and false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getValue in class Overlay
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to evaluate
        Returns:
        a BooleanType with true or false depending on the overlay value.

      • getThreshold

        public int getThreshold()
        Get the threshold of this binary overlay.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the pixel value of the threshold
